name: Box Plot Experiment in Grossbeeren
trial_institution: Leibniz Institute of Vegetable and Ornamental Crops
research_theme: Effect of different mineral and organic fertilization strategies within an irrigated vegetable crop rotation system for three different soils
crop_rotation_trial: 10 rotations of vegetable species white cabbage (Brassica oleracea L. var. capitata f. alba), carrot (Daucus carota L.), cucumber (Cucumis sativus L.), leek (Allium porrum L.) and celery (Apium graveolens L. var. rapaceum Mill.)
research_parameters: Plant: yield, N, P, K, Mg; Soil: Corg, Nt, P, K, Mg, pH value
fertilization_levels: mineral N-Fertilization (3 levels); organic fertilization (4 levels)
one_factorial_lte: SoilSoil type (weak loamy sand, heavy sandy loam, medium clayey silt)
two_factorial_lte: Organic fertilizer (control, farmyard manure, pine bark, harvest residues, farmyard manure + harvest residues, pine bark + harvest residues, manure solids)
multifactorial_lte: Mineral fertilizer (low N-level, medium N-level, high N-level with dosage differences from 1972 to 1986 and 1986 to 2022)
soil_group_wrb: Arenic Luvisol (weak loamy sand), Gleyic Fluvisol (heavy sandy loam) and Luvic-Phaeozem (medium clayey silt) according to the World Reference Base – WRB (and the Bodenkundliche Kartieranleitung – KA6)
literature:
Ruehlmann, J. (2012). The Box Plot Experiment in Grossbeeren after eight rotations: nitrogen, carbon and energy balances. name: ABC Foundation Experimental Station
research_theme: Soil organic carbon (SOC) storage, crop yield, and soil resilience conservation agriculture
tillage_trial: Four types: Conventional Tillage (CT), Minimum Tillage (MT), No-till with Chisel Plowing (NTch), Continuous No-till System (NTS)
fertilization_trial: Two main treatments: Full Crop Fertilization (FCF), and Low Crop Fertilization (LCF).
crop_rotation_trial: Soybean (Glycine max L.) and corn (Zea mays L.) during the summer, followed by wheat (Triticum aestivum L.) in the winter.
networks: National Council for Scientific and Technological Development
research_parameters: Highly weathered soils,  fertilizer use efficiency, permanganate-oxidized C, hot water-extracted C
tillage_levels: Conventional Tillage (CT): 20 cm , Minimum Tillage (MT): 25 cm, No-till with Chisel Plowing (NTch): 25 cm
fertilization_levels: Full Crop Fertilization (FCF): application of phosphorus (P) and potassium (K). Low Crop Fertilization (LCF): removal of phosphorus and potassium nutrients from all crops.
crop_rotation_levels: Sequence of crops planted during different seasons
multifactorial_lte: Soil Management Systems, Fertilization Levels, Crop Rotation
replication: Each treatment was replicated across multiple blocks
organic_carbon_prc: Inorganic carbon is below 0.25% of the total carbon for this soil
further_soil_info: Soil pH was measured in water at a soil/water ratio of 1:2.5
literature: Oliveira Ferreira, A. de, Moraes Sá, J. C. de, Lal, R., Barth, G., Inagaki, T. M., Gonçalves, D. P., ... & others. (2024). name: Prospective
research_parameters: Top Soil ph:8.3, Nt : 0.14%, Ct:1.4%, Effective plant rooting depth (Zr): 120cm
experimental_setup:
2 Block Design, 1 No Replicate (3 experiments:
-	Cropped, organic waste + mineral N: block design
-	Cropped, organic waste without mineral N : block design
-	Bare soil + organic waste : no replicate )
fertilization_levels:
Mineral N / No mineral N
Crop / No Crop
Organic waste (5 levels) / No organic waste
crop_rotation_levels: Grain maize – winter whear – sugar beet – spring barley (2000-2020) Winter wheat - grain maize (since 2021) Cover crop (mustard) before grain maize and sugar beet since 2014
number_plots: 60 (6 in each experiment (no organic waste, sludge, sludge compost, farmyard manure, composted manure, biowaste compost))
literature: Chen, H., Levavasseur, F., Montenach, D., Lollier, M, Morel, C., Houot, S. (2022) "An 18-year field experiment to assess how various types of organic waste used at European regulatory rates sustain crop yields and C, N, P, and K dynamics in a French calcareous soil" https://doi.org/10.1016/j.still.2022.105415 ; Michaud, A. M., Snappin-Didier, V., Cambier, P., Nguyen, C., Janot, N., Montenach, D., Filipovic, L., Deltreil, V., Houot, S. (2021) "Phytoavailability of Cd, Cr, Cu, Hg, Mn, Mo, Ni, Pb, Tl and Zn in Arable Crop Systems Amended for 13 to 15 Years with Organic Waste Products " https://doi.org/10.3390/agronomy11040664 ; Chen, H., Levavasseur, F., Houot, S. (2024) "Substitution of mineral N fertilizers with organic wastes in two long-term field experiments: Dynamics and drivers of crop yields " https://doi.org/10.1111/sum.13079

name: Lime and phosphorus, R3-1001-1941, Lanna
research_theme: Phosphorus addition on soil and crops
tillage_trial: Yes (Plowed once per year down to 20 cm depth)
fertilization_trial: Different levels and types of phosphorus addition
crop_rotation_trial:
"Initial fixed 7-year: winter wheat, peas, spring cereals, ley I, ley II, spring cereals, and fallow. 
Since the late 1950s, the rotation has included only cereals, oil seeds, and occasional fallow."
research_parameters: Liming, phosphorus levels, soil and crop health
experimental_setup: Split-split plot design with liming at start, re-liming in 1974, and different phosphorus levels
tillage_levels: Plowed once per year down to 20 cm depth
fertilization_levels: Superphosphate 1 (17.5 kg P/ha annually), superphosphate 2 (105 kg P/ha every 6th year), thomas phosphate 1 (17.5 kg P/ha annually), thomas phosphate 2 (105 kg P/ha every 6th year)
crop_rotation_levels: Initially fixed rotation, post-1950s cereals, oil seeds, occasional fallow
multifactorial_lte: Three factors: liming at start, re-liming in 1974, phosphorus levels
literature: Spohn, M., Braun, S. & Sierra, C.A. Continuous decrease in soil organic matter despite increased plant productivity in an 80-years-old phosphorus-addition experiment. name: Les Closeaux
trial_institution: INRA Unite Agro-Impact; Arvalis Institut du Vegetal; Chambre d¬íAgriculture du Finistere, Rue Fernand Christ, 02007 Laon Cedex, France
research_parameters: SOM, SOC, pH, Cation exchange capacity (CEC), Iron oxides,adsorption, Plant-residue
experimental_setup: 32 plots of 15x6.4 m² each installed in 1992 on a wheat field cultivated for at least 50 yr, (mainly in cereals, and no C4 plant). Each growing season from 1993 to 2001, 3 (4 in 1993) randomly selected plots were sown to maize, the other ones being cropped with winter wheat. 4 control plots are left under wheat. All crop residues are returned to soil after harvest; the field is tilled in October. The plots have received from 0 years of maize after wheat (in control plots), to 33 years of maize after wheat, with 3 replicates from 25 to 32 years and 4 replicates for the 33th year
crop_rotation_levels: No rotation: either winter wheat or maize
texture: Silt loam in topsoil , silty-clay-loam in subsoil
